_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
National Welders conducts its operations to prevent possible releases or harm to its products, employees and to the surrounding area and residents.  The facility uses a Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) as the foundation of the chemical prevention program. The PHA systematically examines the equipment, systems and procedures for handling chlorine and sulfur dioxide in order to identify the hazards that exist and how to control them. The PHA included a team review of the process using the A?what-if/checklistA? methodology to identify hazards, review of previous incidents, verification of controls and the consequences of their failure, review of issues related to sitting and human factors and a qualitative evaluation of failures of control.

This facility conducts chlorine and sulfur dioxide processing, consisting of receiving, handling and shipping already filled 150 pound cylinders.  No chlorine or sulfur dioxide cylinder filling, releasing, transferring, or servicing is part of the normal National Welders operations.  National Welders will have a maximum inventory of 11,250 pounds of chlorine (75 - 150 lb cylinders) and 9,000 poounds of sulfur dioxide (60-150 lb cylinders).  

National Welders implements many Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for the safe handling of chlorine, sulfur dioxide,  and other compressed gas cylinders to prevent any accidental release.  Along with the written SOPA?s, several administrative controls are used.  These include, operator training, emergency procedures, qualification of operators, and inventory control.  The company has both a Type A emergency kit and an SA emergency kit on site to stop a potential leak from either a chlorine or sulfur dioxide cylinder. 

National Welders in Columbia, South Carolina has not had a reportable accident to date.

Emergency response training includes training of key response personnel in the use of emergency repair kits.  Hazardous material communication training is also conducted to protect the safet
